newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Ahrend sees 1996 net profit up 25 pct.
newsitem.headline: Ahrend sees 1996 net profit up 25 pct.

text.p: Office equipment group Ahrend NV said on Tuesday it expected preliminary 1996 net profit to have risen by 25 percent to 41.8 million guilders.
In 1995, the company posted net profit of 33.5 million guilders.
Ahrend said in a statement 1996 turnover was seen at 749 million guilders, up almost nine percent from the 689 million posted in the previous year.
Profits per share rose by more than 22 percent to 5.42 guilders from 4.43 in 1995.

Ahrend said turnover of its office furniture division grew by eight percent to 452 million guilders. This market showed scant change in most European countries but in the Netherlands Ahrend raised its furniture sales by 10 percent. The German furniture market deteriorated and sales in Belgium fell by 10 percent. Office equipment sales rose by 10 percent to 297 million guilders, Ahrend said.
The company will publish its full 1996 results on March 11.
